snippet: Rebel forces in Syria’s largest city said on Wednesday that government forces had launched a ground assault, forcing them to pull back from parts of a key neighborhood.
abstract: Rebel fighters in Aleppo say that government forces have opened a ground assault, forcing them to pull back from parts of the city because their ammunition is running low; developments coincide with contradictory reports involving the role of other countries in Syria’s conflict.

byline.original: By DAMIEN CAVE and DALAL MAWAD
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alan Cowell from London, Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Ellen Barry from Moscow, Steven Lee Myers from Washington, Rick Gladstone from New York, and Ranya Kadri from Amman, Jordan.

lead_paragraph: Rebel forces in Syria’s largest city said on Wednesday that government forces had launched a ground assault, forcing them to pull back from parts of a key neighborhood.

headline.seo: Rebels Withdraw From Parts of Aleppo as Government Forces Mass
headline.main: Rebels Pull Back as Syrian Military Continues Moving In on Aleppo
headline.print_headline: Rebels Pull Back as Syrian Military Continues Moving In on Aleppo

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
